Luthetus.Common.RazorLib.TreeViews.Displays.TreeViewContainerDisplay Class Reference Luthetus.Common.RazorLib.TreeViews.Displays.TreeViewContainerDisplay
TODO: SphagettiCode - The context menu logic feels scuffed. A field is used to track the "_mostRecentContextMenuEvent". This feels quite wrong and should be looked into. (2023-09-19).
Inheritance diagram for Luthetus.Common.RazorLib.TreeViews.Displays.TreeViewContainerDisplay:
Collaboration diagram for Luthetus.Common.RazorLib.TreeViews.Displays.TreeViewContainerDisplay:

Key< TreeViewContainer > TreeViewContainerKey = Key<TreeViewContainer>.Empty [get, set]
TreeViewMouseEventHandler TreeViewMouseEventHandler = null! [get, set]
TreeViewKeyboardEventHandler TreeViewKeyboardEventHandler = null! [get, set]
string CssClassString = string.Empty [get, set]
string CssStyleString = string.Empty [get, set]
RenderFragment< TreeViewCommandArgs >? OnContextMenuRenderFragment [get, set]
If a consumer of the TreeView component does not have logic for their own DropdownComponent, then one can provide a RenderFragment and a dropdown will be rendered for the consumer and their RenderFragment is rendered within that dropdown.If one has their own DropdownComponent, then it is recommended that they use OnContextMenuFunc instead.
Func< TreeViewCommandArgs, Task >? OnContextMenuFunc [get, set]
If a consumer of the TreeView component does not have logic for their own DropdownComponent, then it is recommended to use OnContextMenuRenderFragment OnContextMenuFunc allows one to be notified of the ContextMenu event along with the necessary parameters by being given TreeViewCommandArgs.
Detailed Description
TODO: SphagettiCode - The context menu logic feels scuffed. A field is used to track the "_mostRecentContextMenuEvent". This feels quite wrong and should be looked into. (2023-09-19).
